title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency response. Grants will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations to conduct research on emergency preparedness in disadvantaged households and develop awareness education programs within these communities. Nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities can receive grants for emergency preparedness programs. Funds can be used for research in African American and Hispanic communities and to create awareness materials. Nonprofit organizations serving disadvantaged communities can receive grants for emergency preparedness programs, including promoting awareness and disseminating information to these communities. To be eligible for funding, organizations must collaborate with national organizations, higher education institutions, and faith-based institutions, and implement joint projects with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. Application and review procedures must be followed to receive grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements under this section. The organization must submit an application to the Director with required information. Definitions for disadvantaged business enterprise, community, and individual are provided. Authorization of appropriation is granted for this section. Authorization of appropriation is granted for fiscal years 2004 through 2007 to carry out this section. The allocated sums shall remain available until expended.
